Description:
SUPPLY OF ASPHALT
Supply of asphalt in accordance with MRTS30 Cl 7 and as detailed in the Subcontractor’s Asphalt Quality Plan (AQP):
• Materials for asphalt in accordance with MRTS30 Cl 7.1
• Requirements for asphalt in accordance with MRTS30 Cl 7.2

Sampling and lab testing frequency - Plant production
On Monthly basis for each mix design
• Tensile Strength Ratio (dense grade only) - 1 per 5000 tonnes (Not required for < 500 tonnes of specific mix type)
• Deformation resistance (Heavy duty dense grade only) - - 1 per 10000 tonnes (Not required for < 5000 tonnes of specific mix type)
• Mix volume ratio (SMA only) - 1 per 5000 tonnes (Not required for total requirement less than 500 tonnes of specific mix type)
• Filler in Asphalt - 1 per month per mix

Product sample Compliance - Moisture Sensitivity (Dense Grade only)
 TSR ≥80%
 Avg Tensile Strength ≥ 500 kPa for mix contains SBS based PMB
 Avg Tensile Strength ≥ 600 kPa for mix with other binders

Asphalt production - Temperature requirement
• Production temperature - As nominated in AQP
• Dispatch temperature - shall be noted in every delivery docket
Temperature shall not exceed as per table 7.4.6 or as per AQP
Inspection Method: Measure Temperature using probe or infrared

Description:
Loading and Delivery of Asphalt
The dispatch temperature of the asphalt must facilitate achieving the specified compaction level in the finished product. Details of the project specific process temperatures and the frequency of recording must be provided in the AQP. 
The temperature of asphalt must not at any time in the process exceed the temperatures stated in Table 7.4.6
Inspection Method: Measure Temperature using probe or infrared

Description:
Asphalt production and Transportation
Production of asphalt in accordance with MRTS30 Cl 7.4 and as detailed in the Subcontractor’s Asphalt Quality Plan (AQP).

Transport of asphalt in accordance with MRTS30 Cl 7.5 and as detailed in the Subcontractor’s Asphalt Quality Plan (AQP).

Surface Preparation-General
 Substrate shall not be Wet
 Remove loose material using rotary broom
 Remove RPM, ATLM

Proof Rolling of Substrate
Surface (constructed by others) on which asphalt will be placed shall be tested for perceptible surface deformation by ‘proof rolling’.

Approval to place asphalt over weak substrate
Unless otherwise approved by the Administrator, asphalt shall not be placed over pavement exhibiting significant perceptible surface deformation.

Crack Filling
 Mark out the extent of crack filling in presence of Administrator (WP)
 Cracks > 2mm wide shall be filled prior to asphalt placement
 Cracks filled using approved polymer modified sealant
 Prior to filling, cracks shall be cleaned with compressed air or vacuumed.
 Cracks filled level with surrounding surface.

Strain Alleviating Strips
 Apply strain alleviating fabric strips to existing cracks prior to placement of asphalt or sprayed sealing.
 Strip shall be minimum 250mm width (125mm each side of crack).
 One pass of Pneumatic roller to ensure proper adhesion.
 Application shall be free from wrinkles and creases
 Apply bituminous emulsion or primer over strip prior to asphalt or spray seal.

Longitudinal Joints
 Away from trafficked wheel paths
 Coincide with final line markings (surface course)
 150mm offset to underlying layer joint except on a crowned pavement)
 Within 150mm of the line of change in Crossfall
Transverse Joints
 located a minimum of 25m apart
 1m offset from underlying layer joint
 Form a joint at each paving run
 Form a joint when a delay in paving causes the fall in asphalt temperature

Placement Trial (If specified)
 Separate trial for each nominated mix
 Review and conform the results for homogeneity, insitu air voids, thickness, surface shape, joint quality and geometrics.
 Further works shall be commenced only after the administrator approval.
 If trial fails, a new trial shall be undertaken for approval

Homogeneity (Visual assessment per lot)
Areas of asphalt that exhibit cracking, ravelling, bony or fatty material, or have been damaged during construction must be rectified or replaced.
Rectification process shall be approved by administrator.

Air-Voids Compliance - Finished Product
Asphalt layers of ≤ 30 mm thickness shall not be tested for insitu air voids. For layers greater than 30mm thickness, refer below table for compliance.
Testing Frequency


Compliance requirement

Surface Texture (SMA only)
Testing frequency

Compliance requirement - Value shall be less than the below.
 0.7 mm for SMA10
 0.7 mm for SMA14 (Speed limit ≤ 80 kph)
 1.1 mm for SMA14 (Speed limit > 80 kph)

Vertical Tolerance (3 Point Pickup at every 20m)
 Level Control (intermediate, base and corrector courses) variance ≤ 10mm
 Thickness Control (Surfacing Courses) variance as per below table
Horizontal Tolerance < 50mm (Pickup at every 20m)

Surface Shape (Straight Edge)
 One measurement at every 20m at longitudinal joint and within lane.
 One measurement per transverse joint.
 Result shall comply below table.

Road Roughness (Minimum lot size is 100m)-Surface Course Only
 Roughness shall not exceed as specified in cl 8 of Annexure MRTS30.1
If not specified value shall not exceed 1.93m/km.
 For road resurfacing IRI shall be as below
IRIa = 0.6 × IRIb + 0.2, or 1.56 m/km, whichever is the greater.

Lot Closure
 All compliance met requirements.
 All Test results received, reviewed and approved.
 All NCRs actioned.
Records:
Correspondence
Verification Checklist
Product certificates
Test reports

Description:
Asphalt Quality Plan (AQP)
 AQP submission - At least seven days prior to work commencement.
 AQP shall include the elements defined in Table 5.2 of MRTS30

Asphalt contractor prequalification
 Asphalt shall be manufactured, placed and compacted by a prequalified asphalt contractor (PAC).
 Minimum Prequalification for SMA - A4
 PAC details shall be notified to administrator at least seven days before asphalt placement Works

Asphalt mix design registration
Mix design(s) are submitted to the Asphalt Mix Design Registrar for registration not less than 28 days prior to asphalt being incorporated into the Works

Nomination of registered mix designs
At least 7 days before asphalt production is required, the Contractor shall submit the copy of the mix design certificate(s) for each nominal size & type of asphalt mix to be incorporated into the works.

Approval prior to incorporation of Asphalt into the works
 Approved PAC
 Approved Mix Design Certificate
 Approved AQP
 Approved Aggregate Production Procedure
 Approved Contractor's RAP
Clause:
MRTS30 Cl 7.4.1
MRTS30 Cl 8.3, 8.11
Annexure MRTS30.1 Cl 4, 6

Description:
Acceptance of Nonconforming mix design for incorporation into the Works 
Nonconforming mix designs that hold current registration with the department shall not be incorporated into the Works unless otherwise accepted in writing by the Administrator prior to the commencement of asphalt production.

Sampling and lab testing frequency of supplied asphalt in each shift
Prior to asphalt placement, supplied asphalt in each shift to be sampled and tested in lab for
• Combined Particle Size Distribution (Cl 7.2.1.1 & 7.4.3.2)
• Binder Content (Cl 7.2.1.2 & 7.4.3.2)
• Maximum density (Cl 7.4.3.2)
• Air-voids (Cl 7.2.2)
Product sample compliance-Combined Particle Size Distribution
Product sample compliance-Binder Content
Product sample Compliance - Air voids
Product sample Compliance - Filler/Binder ratio, binder film index

Product sample Compliance - Moisture Content & Particle Coating
 Moisture content < 0.5% by mass of total mix.
 Particle coating ≥ 99% once discharged from plant.

Procedures for nonconforming TSR (TSR <80%) - Dense Graded
TSR <70% and air voids nonconforming, TSR NCR will not be accepted.
Product sample Compliance - Deformation Resistance (SMA & Heavy duty dense grade only)

Product sample Compliance - Others
 Asphalt binder drain-off < 0.3% (OG & SMA only)
 Asphalt particle loss ≤ 20% (OG only)
 Mix Volume Ratio ≤ 1.04 (SMA only)

MTV Requirement
For SMA and OGA - Mandatory
For Dense Grade Asphalt - If specified in Cl 4 of Annexure MRTS30.1
Contractor shall demonstrate capacity and capability of MTV defined in Cl 8.3
Exclusions
• Tapers
• Roundabouts of radius less than 50m
• Turning lanes less than 100m in length
• Areas approved by Administrator

Protection of work, services and road furnitures
 No traffic until the asphalt placed, compacted and cooled sufficiently
 Protect services (pits, drains, pipes etc.,) against asphalt spilling
 Remove all waste asphalt and clean job site
Nominated layer thickness

Approval to place asphalt of nonconforming layer thickness
Placement of asphalt in a nonconforming layer thickness shall not occur unless approved by the Administrator.

Pavement temperature (One measurement every 2 hours)
Asphalt placement shall not commence or continue, unless the pavement surface temperature complies with the requirements of Table 8.7
Inspection Method: Measure Temperature using probe or infrared

Description:
Paving and compaction temperatures (One test every load delivered)
The Contractor’s AQP must document the temperatures at which the asphalt is placed and compacted to achieve the Insitu air voids requirements specified in Clause 9.2.1
Inspection Method: Measure Temperature using probe or infrared

Description:
Tack Coat (One test per lot)
 Design Tack Coat _____________
 Surface Is clean, dry and free from loose material
 Tack coat is to be dried before asphalt placement

Temporary Ramps joining existing pavement & structures
At Transverse Joint
 Speed Limit ≤ 60km/h - 1.5m length per each 50mm (or part thereof)
 Speed Limit > 60km/h - 2.5m length per each 50mm (or part thereof)
At Longitudinal Joint 
 1.0m length per each 50mm (or part thereof)
Interface with Structures (MH, Gully Pits, Utility Covers etc.,)
 1.0m length per each 50mm (or part thereof)

Surface Gritting (SMA only)
 Grit material shall comply properties as defined in Table 8.13
 Uniform spread, rolled into surface of hot asphalt
 Loose grit removed prior to opening to traffic
 For SMA10 Spread Rate ≥ 0.2 kg/m²
 For SMA14 Spread Rate ≥ 0.3 kg/m²

General Cleaning
 Joint trimmings shall be cleaned-up and discarded (cut to waste) .
 Finished asphalt surface shall be free from loose/waste asphalt and shall be cleaned.
